summary: This module provides an inbound OAuth2 authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate the provided credentials against an introspection endpoint and an outbound OAuth2 authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate an external endpoint.
description:
Module Overview

This module provides an inbound OAuth2 authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate the provided credentials against an introspection endpoint and an outbound OAuth2 authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate an external endpoint.

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below Functions. For examples on the usage of the operations, see the Secured Service with OAuth2 Example and Secured Client with OAuth2 Example.

fields.name: tokenUrl
fields.description: Token URL for the authorization endpoint

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: Client ID for the client credentials grant authentication

fields.name: clientSecret
fields.description: Client secret for the client credentials grant authentication

fields.name: scopes
fields.description: Scope(s) of the access request

fields.name: clockSkewInSeconds
fields.description: Clock skew in seconds

fields.name: retryRequest
fields.description: Retry the request if the initial request returns a 401 response

fields.name: credentialBearer
fields.description: Bearer of the authentication credentials, which is sent to the authorization endpoint

fields.name: clientConfig
fields.description: HTTP client configurations, which are used to call the authorization endpoint

records.name: ClientCredentialsGrantConfig
records.description: The data structure, which is used to configure the OAuth2 client credentials grant type.

fields.name: accessToken
fields.description: Access token for the authorization endpoint

fields.name: refreshConfig
fields.description: Configurations for refreshing the access token

fields.name: clockSkewInSeconds
fields.description: Clock skew in seconds

fields.name: retryRequest
fields.description: Retry the request if the initial request returns a 401 response

fields.name: credentialBearer
fields.description: Bearer of the authentication credentials, which is sent to the authorization endpoint

records.name: DirectTokenConfig
records.description: The data structure, which is used to configure the OAuth2 access token directly.

fields.name: refreshUrl
fields.description: Refresh token URL for the refresh token server

fields.name: refreshToken
fields.description: Refresh token for the refresh token server

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: Client ID for authentication with the authorization endpoint

fields.name: clientSecret
fields.description: Client secret for authentication with the authorization endpoint

records.name: DirectTokenRefreshConfig
records.description: The data structure, which can be used to pass the configurations for refreshing the access token directly.

fields.name: active
fields.description: Boolean indicator of whether or not the presented token is currently active

fields.name: scopes
fields.description: A JSON string containing a space-separated list of scopes associated with this token

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: Client identifier for the OAuth 2.0 client, which requested this token

fields.name: username
fields.description: Resource owner who authorized this token

fields.name: tokenType
fields.description: Type of the token

fields.name: exp
fields.description: Expiry time (seconds since the Epoch)

fields.name: iat
fields.description: Time when the token was issued originally (seconds since the Epoch)

fields.name: nbf
fields.description: Token is not to be used before this time (seconds since the Epoch)

fields.name: sub
fields.description: Subject of the token

fields.name: aud
fields.description: Intended audience of the token

fields.name: iss
fields.description: Issuer of the token

fields.name: jti
fields.description: String identifier for the token

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of the introspection server

fields.name: tokenTypeHint
fields.description: A hint about the type of the token submitted for introspection

fields.name: oauth2Cache
fields.description: Cache used to store the OAuth2 token and other related information

fields.name: defaultTokenExpTimeInSeconds
fields.description: Expiration time of the tokens if introspection response does not contain an exp field

fields.name: clientConfig
fields.description: HTTP client configurations which calls the introspection server

fields.name: accessToken
fields.description: Access token received from the authorization endpoint

fields.name: refreshToken
fields.description: Refresh token for the refresh token server

fields.name: expTime
fields.description: Expiry time (milliseconds since the Epoch) of the access token

records.name: OutboundOAuth2CacheEntry
records.description: The data structure, which stores the values received from the authorization/token server to use them for the latter requests without requesting tokens again.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Provides authentication based on the provided introspection configurations.

returnParameters.description: true if authentication is successful, false otherwise, or else an auth:Error if an error occurred

methods.name: authenticate
methods.description:
Authenticates the provider OAuth2 tokens with an introspection endpoint.

 boolean|auth:Error result = inboundOAuth2Provider.authenticate("<credential>");

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Provides authentication based on the provided introspection configurations.

returnParameters.description: true if authentication is successful, false otherwise, or else an auth:Error if an error occurred

otherMethods.name: authenticate
otherMethods.description:
Authenticates the provider OAuth2 tokens with an introspection endpoint.

 boolean|auth:Error result = inboundOAuth2Provider.authenticate("<credential>");

objects.name: InboundOAuth2Provider
objects.description:
Represents the inbound OAuth2 provider, which calls the introspection server, validates the received credentials, and performs authentication and authorization. The oauth2:InboundOAuth2Provider is an implementation of the auth:InboundAuthProvider interface.

 oauth2:IntrospectionServerConfig introspectionServerConfig = {
     url: "https://localhost:9196/oauth2/token/introspect"
 };
 oauth2:InboundOAuth2Provider inboundOAuth2Provider = new(introspectionServerConfig);

methods.name: init
methods.description: Provides authentication based on the provided OAuth2 configuration.

returnParameters.description: Generated string token or else an auth:Error if an error occurred

methods.name: generateToken
methods.description:
Generate a token for the OAuth2 authentication.

 string:auth:Error token = outboundOAuth2Provider.generateToken();

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Map of data, which is extracted from the HTTP response

returnParameters.description: Generated string token, an auth:Error occurred while generating the token, or else () if nothing is to be returned

methods.name: inspect
methods.description:
Inspects the incoming data and generates the token for the OAuth2 authentication.

 string:auth:Error? token = outboundOAuth2Provider.inspect(data);

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Provides authentication based on the provided OAuth2 configuration.

returnParameters.description: Generated string token or else an auth:Error if an error occurred

otherMethods.name: generateToken
otherMethods.description:
Generate a token for the OAuth2 authentication.

 string:auth:Error token = outboundOAuth2Provider.generateToken();

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Map of data, which is extracted from the HTTP response

returnParameters.description: Generated string token, an auth:Error occurred while generating the token, or else () if nothing is to be returned

otherMethods.name: inspect
otherMethods.description:
Inspects the incoming data and generates the token for the OAuth2 authentication.

 string:auth:Error? token = outboundOAuth2Provider.inspect(data);

objects.name: OutboundOAuth2Provider
objects.description:
Represents the outbound OAuth2 provider, which generates OAtuh2 tokens. This supports the client credentials grant type, password grant type, and the direct token mode, which sends the access token directly. The oauth2:OutboundOAuth2Provider is an implementation of the auth:OutboundAuthProvider interface.

  1. Client Credentials Grant Type
 oauth2:OutboundOAuth2Provider oauth2Provider1 = new({
     tokenUrl: "https://localhost:9196/oauth2/token",
     clientId: "3MVG9YDQS5WtC11paU2WcQjBB3L",
     clientSecret: "9205371918321623741",
     scopes: ["token-scope1", "token-scope2"]
 });
  1. Password Grant Type
 oauth2:OutboundOAuth2Provider oauth2Provider5 = new({
     tokenUrl: "https://localhost:9196/oauth2/token/authorize/header",
     username: "johndoe",
     password: "A3ddj3w",
     clientId: "3MVG9YDQS5WtC11paU2WcQjBB3L",
     clientSecret: "9205371918321623741",
     scopes: ["token-scope1", "token-scope2"]
 });
  1. Direct Token Mode
 oauth2:OutboundOAuth2Provider oauth2Provider13 = new({
     accessToken: "2YotnFZFEjr1zCsicMWpAA",
     refreshConfig: {
         refreshUrl: "https://localhost:9196/oauth2/token/refresh",
         refreshToken: "XlfBs91yquexJqDaKEMzVg==",
         clientId: "3MVG9YDQS5WtC11paU2WcQjBB3L",
         clientSecret: "9205371918321623741",
         scopes: ["token-scope1", "token-scope2"]
     }
 });

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: OAuth2 token, which needs to be validated

returnParameters.description: OAuth2 introspection server response or else an oauth2:Error if token validation fails

functions.name: validateOAuth2Token
functions.description:
Validates the given OAuth2 token by calling the OAuth2 introspection endpoint.

 oauth2:IntrospectionResponse|oauth2:Error result = oauth2:validateOAuth2Token(token, introspectionServerConfig);
